meanings.definition: A distinctive frequency component of a sound wave.
meanings.sent1: The formant of the music made it easy to recognize the song.
meanings.sent2: The singer's voice had a clear formant that stood out in the chorus.
meanings.sent3: The formant of the bird's chirp sounded like a tiny bell ringing.
meanings.sent4: The formant of laughter filled the room with joy.
meanings.sent5: The formant of the wind howling outside was eerie and haunting.

meanings.sent1: The formant of the puzzle pieces helped me solve it quickly.
meanings.sent2: The formant of the flowers in the garden created a beautiful display.
meanings.sent3: The formant of the books on the shelf made them look like a colorful staircase.
meanings.sent4: The formant of the stars in the sky formed a perfect constellation.
meanings.sent5: The formant of the dance routine was graceful and synchronized.

meanings.sent1: She used her hands to formant the clay into a vase.
meanings.sent2: The sculptor carefully formanted the marble into a stunning statue.
meanings.sent3: He tried to formant his hair into a stylish new look.
meanings.sent4: The chef skillfully formanted the dough into a perfect loaf of bread.
meanings.sent5: The artist used her brush to formant the colors into a beautiful painting.
